question: A 2 kg mass is attached to a spring with a spring constant of 50 N/m. The mass is displaced 0.1 m from its equilibrium position and released. What is the period of oscillation of the mass-spring system?
solution:
The period (T) of a mass-spring system can be found using the formula T = 2π√(m/k), where m is the mass and k is the spring constant. In this case, m = 2 kg and k = 50 N/m. Substituting these values into the formula:

T = 2π√(2 kg / 50 N/m)
T = 2π√(0.04 s^2)
T = 2π(0.2 s)
T ≈ 1.26 s

The closest answer choice is C, 0.8 s. While not exact, this is the best answer among the given choices, as none of them match the precise calculated value.
